translation: Vaar 22
One Oankar,the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor
The formless Lord who is without any anchor and is imperceptible, has not made himself fully known to anyone.
From unembodiment He assumed the form by himself and becoming Oankar
He created infinite wondrous forms.
In the form of the true name (ndm) and becoming the creator, He came to be known as the protector of His own reputation.
Through three dimensional maya He nourishes one and all.
He is the creator of the cosmos and prescribes its destiny.

gurmukhi: ਸਭਸੈ ਦੇ ਅਾਧਾਰੁ ਨ ਤੋਲਿ ਤੁਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sabhasai Day Aadhaaru N Toli Tulaaiaa.
translation: He is the basis of all, the incomparable One.

gurmukhi: ਲਿਖਿਅਾ ਥਿਤਿ ਨ ਵਾਰੁ ਨ ਮਾਹੁ ਜਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Lakhiaa Diti N Vaaru N Maahu Janaaiaa.
translation: None has ever disclosed the date, the day and month (of creation).

gurmukhi: ਵੇਦ ਕਤੇਬ ਵੀਚਾਰ ਨ ਅਾਖਿ ਸੁਣਾੲਿਅਾ ||੧||
transliteration: Vayd Katayb Veechaaru N Aakhi Sounaaiaa ?1?
translation: Even the Vedas and other scriptures could not fully explain His thoughts.
Divine Power
Who without any props, and uncontrolled by habit has created behavioural patterns?
How the swan reaches the heights of sky?
Wondrous is the mystery of wings which made the swan to soar at such heights.

gurmukhi: ਧ੍ਰੂ ਚੜਿਅਾ ਅਸਮਾਣਿ ਨ ਟਲ ਟਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Dhr Charhiaa Asamaani N Talai Talaaiaa.
translation: How did Dhruv in the form of immovable star mount the sky?
It is a mystery how a humble eschewing ego acquires honour in life.
Only the gurmukh who has meditated upon Lord is accepted in His court.
Divine Power

gurmukhi: ਓੜਕੁ ਓੜਕੁ ਭਾਲਿ ਨ ਓੜਕੁ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Aorhaku Aorhaku Bhaali N Aorhaku Paaiaa.
translation: In order to know Him, people put in extreme efforts but could not know His extant.

gurmukhi: ਓੜਕ ਭਾਲਣਿ ਗੲੇ ਸਿ ਫੇਰ ਨ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ||
transliteration: Aorhaku Bhaalani Gaay Si Dhayr N Aaiaa.
translation: Those who went out to know His bounds could never return.
To know Him, myriads of people have remained wandering in illusions.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਦੁ ਵਡਾ ਵਿਸਮਾਦੁ ਨ ਅੰਤੁ ਸੁਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Aadu Vadaa Visamaadu N Antu Sounaaiaa.
translation: That primeval Lord is the grand wonder whose mystery cannot be understood by mere listening.
His waves, shades etc are limitless.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕੁ ਕਵਾੳੁ ਪਸਾੳੁ ਨ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Iku Kavaau Pasaau N Alakhu Lakhaaiaa.
translation: The imperceptible Lord who has created all through His single vibration cannot be perceived.
I am sacrifice unto that creator, whose maya is this creation.
The Guru has made me understand that God alone knows about His own self (none else can know Him).
The Creation
The true Creator as the Truth is pervading one and all.

gurmukhi: ਸਚਹੁ ਪੳੁਣ ੳੁਪਾੲਿ ਘਟਿ ਘਟਿ ਛਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sachahu Paounu Oupaai Ghati Ghati Chhaaiaa.
translation: Out of Truth He created air and (in the form of vital air) is residing in all
From air was created water which always remains humble i.e. it. always moves down wards.
Earth as a raft is made to float on water.
From water emerged fire which spread throughout the whole vegetation.
By virtue of this very fire (heat) the trees became. full of fruits
In this way, air, water and fire were integrated under the order of that primaeval Lord
And thus was this game of creation arranged.
Creation
Flow great is the'truth that it is liked by that true One (God).
How vast is the air that moves in all the four directions.
Fragrance is placed in sandal which makes other trees also fragrant.

gurmukhi: ਖਹਿ ਖਹਿ ਵੰਸੁ ਗਵਾੲਿ ਵਾਂਸੁ ਜਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Khahi Khahi Vansu Gavaai Vaansu Jalaaiaa.
translation: Bamboos burn by their own friction and destroy their own abode.
The forms of the bodies have become visible y the association of Siva and Sakti.
One distinguishes between the cuckoo and the crow by listening to their voice.
He created the four life-mines and endowed them worthy speech and judiciously gifted breaths.
He made the A's accept the five gross varieties of the (subtle) unstuck Word and thus on the beat of drum He pronounced His supremacy over all.
Qualities of a sadhu
Music, melody, dialogue and knowledge make man a conscious being.
By disciplining the nine gates of the body one is called a sadhu.

gurmukhi: ਵੀਹ ੲਿਕੀਹ ੳੁਲੰਘਿ ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Veeh Ikeeh Ulaghi Nij Ghari Aaiaa.
translation: Transcending the worldy illusions he stabilizes within his self.
Prior to this, he was running after various practices of hath yoga,
Such as the rechak, purak, kumbhak, tratak, nyolrand bhujarig asan.
He practised different processes of breathing like ire', pirigala and susumna.
He perfected their khechari and chachari postures.
Through such mysterious sport he establishes himself in the equipoise.
Yoga

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰੈਸਤੁ ਅੰਗੁਲ ਲੈ ਮਨੁ ਪਵਣੁ ਮਿਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Trai Satu Angul Lai Manu Pavanu Milaaiaa.
translation: The breath going ten fingers out the mind is associated with the vital air the practice is completed.
The imperceptible soham (I am He) is ualised in equipoise.
In this state of equipoise, the rare drink of ever-wing cascade is quaffed.

gurmukhi: ਅਨਹਦ ਧੁਨਿ ਲਿਵ ਲਾੲਿ ਨਾਦ ਵਜਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Anahad Dhouni Liv Laai Naad Vajaaiaa.
translation: Getting absorbed in the unstruck melody a mysterious sound is heard.
Through silent prayer, one merges in the Suny (Lord)
And in that perfect mental tranquillity egoism is done away with.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪਿਰਮ ਚਖਾੲਿ ਨਿਜ ਘਰੁ ਛਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Piramu Chakhaai Nij Gharu Chhaaiaa.
translation: The gurmukhs drink from the cup of love and establish themselves in their own real self.
Meeting the Guru, the Sikh achieves the perfect completeness.
The Guru and the Sikh
As the lamp is lit from the flame of another lamp;
As sandal's fragrance makes the whole vegetation fragrant
As the water mixing with water acquires the status of trivevi(the confluence of three rivers - Gatiga; Yamuna and Sarasvati);
As air after meeting the vital air becomes unstruck melody;
As a diamond being perforated by another diamond gets stringed into a necklace;
A stone by becoming the philosopher's stone performs its feat and

gurmukhi: ਅਨਲ ਪੰਖ ਪੁਤੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਪਿਤਾ ਸਮ੍ਹਾਲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Anal Pankhi Poutu Hoi Pitaa Samhaaliaa.
translation: As an anil bird getting birth in the sky promotes the work of its father;
Likewise the Guru making the Sikh meet the Lord establishes him in the equipoise.
Praises of the Lord
How great is His one vibration which has created the whole expanse of the world!
How big is His weighing hook that it has sustained the whole creation!
Creating crores of universes He has spread around His power of speech.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਲਖ ਧਰਤਿ ਅਗਾਸਿ ਅਧਰ ਧਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Lakh Lakh Dharati Agaasi Adhar Dharaaiaa.
translation: Lakhs of earths and skies He kept hanging without support.
Million types of airs, waters and fires He created.
He created the game of eighty four lakhs of species.

gurmukhi: ਜੋਨਿ ਜੋਨਿ ਜੀਅ ਜੰਤ ਅੰਤ ਨ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Joni Joni Jeea Jant Antu N Paaiaa.
translation: No end is known of the creatures of even one species.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਰਿ ਸਿਰਿ ਲੇਖੁ ਲਿਖਾੲਿ ਅਲੇਖੁ ਧਿਅਾੲਿਅਾ ||੯||
transliteration: Siri Siri Laykhu Likhaai Alaykhu Dhiaaiaa ?9?
translation: He has engraved writ on the forehead of all so that they all meditate upon the Lord who is beyond writ.
The way of Gurmukhs
The true Guru has recited (to the disciples) the true name.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਮੂਰਤਿ ਸਚੁ ਥਾੳੁ ਧਿਅਾਨੁ ਧਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Moorati Sachu Daau Dhiaanu Dharaaiaa.
translation: Gurmurati,the word of the Guru is the real object to meditate upon.
The holy congregation is such a refuge where the truth adorns the place.
In the court of the true justice, the order of the Lord prevails.
The village (abode) of the Gurmukhs is the truth which has been habitated with the Word (Sabad).
The ego is decimated there and the (pleasure giving) shade of humility is obtained there.
Through the wisdom of Guru (Gurmati) the unbearable truth is instilled into the heart.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਸੁ ਬਲਿਹਾਰੈ ਜਾੳੁ ਸੁ ਭਾਣਾ ਭਾੲਿਅਾ ||੧੦||
transliteration: Tisu Balihaarai Jaau Su Bhaanaa Bhaaiaa ?10?
translation: I am sacrifice unto him who loves the Will of the Lord.
Gurmukh, the supereme stage
Gurmukhs accept the will of that Lord as truth and they love His will.
Bowing at the feet of the true Guru, they shed their sense of ego.
As disciples, they please the Guru and the heart of the Gum becomes happy.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਹਜਿ ਸੁਭਾੲਿ ਨ ਅਲਖ ਲਖਾਵਣਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Sahaji Soubhaai N Alakh Lakhaavanaa.
translation: The gurmukh realises the imperceptible Lord spontaneously.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਤਿਲ ਨ ਤਮਾੲਿ ਕਾਰ ਕਮਾਵਣਾ
transliteration: Gurasikh Til N Tamaai Kaar Kamaavanaa.
translation: The Sikh of Guru has no greed at all and he earns his livelihood by the labour of his hands.

transliteration: Sabad Surati Liv Laai Houkamu Manaavanaa.
translation: Merging his consciousness into the word he obeys the commands of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਵੀਹ ੲਿਕੀਹ ਲੰਘਾੲਿ ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਜਾਵਣਾ
transliteration: Veeh Ikeeh Laghaai Nij Ghari Jaavanaa.
translation: Crossing beyond the worldly illusions he abides in his own real self.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਪਾੲਿ ਸਹਜਿ ਸਮਾਵਣਾ ||੧੧||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Paai Sahaji Samaavanaa ?11?
translation: This way, the gurmukhs having attained the pleasure fruit absorb themselves in equipoise.
Guru Angad Dev

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕੁ ਗੁਰੂ ੲਿਕੁ ਸਿਖੁ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਜਾਣਿਅਾ
transliteration: Iku Guroo Iku Sikhu Guramoukhi Jaaniaa.
translation: Gurmukhs knew very well about the one Guru (Nanak) and one disciple (Guru Angad).

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਚੇਲਾ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖੁ ਸਚਿ ਸਮਾਣਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Chaylaa Gur Sikhu Sachi Samaaniaa.
translation: By becoming the true Sikh of the Guru, this disciple virtually merged himself into the latter.

gurmukhi: ਸੋ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸੋ ਸਿਖੁ ਸਬਦੁ ਵਖਾਣਿਅਾ
transliteration: So Satigur So Sikhu Sabadu Vakhaaniaa.
translation: The true Guru and the disciple were identical (in spirit) and their Word was also one.
This is the wonder of the past and the future that they (both) loved the truth.
They were beyond all accounts and were honour of the humble ones.

gurmukhi: ਸਮਸਰਿ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਵਿਖੁ ਨ ਅਾਵਣ ਜਾਣਿਅਾ
transliteration: Samasari Anmritu Vikhu N Aavan Jaaniaa.
translation: For them, the nectar and poison were the same and they had got liberated from the cycle of transmigration
Recorded as the model of special virtues, they are known as the extremely honourable ones.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖਹੁ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਹੈਰਾਣਿਅਾ ||੧੨||
transliteration: Gur Sikhahu Gur Sikhu Hoi Hairaaniaa ?12?
translation: The wonderful fact is that the sikh of the Guru became the Guru.

gurmukhi: ੧੩ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਾਂ ਦੇ ਲੱਛਨ ਤੇ ਧੂੜ ਦਾ ਪ੍ਰਤਾਪ
translation: Virtues of the gurmukhs and the glory of the dust
Gurmukhs drink the unbearable Cup of love filled to the brims and being in the presence of the all;
Pervading Lord they perceive the imperceptible.
The one who resides in all hearts is dwelling in their hearts.
The love creeper of their's has become full of fruits as the seedling of grape turns out to be fruitful vine.
Becoming sandal, they provide coolness to one and all.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦਨ ਚੰਦ ਕਪੂਰ ਨ ਮੇਲਿ ਮਿਲਾਵਣਾ
translation: Their cool is like the coolness of sandal, moon, and camphor.
Associating the sun (rajas) with the moon (sattv) they assuage its heat.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਦੀ ਧੂਰਿ ਮਸਤਕਿ ਲਾਵਣਾ
transliteration: Charan Kaval Dee Dhoori Masataki Laavanaa.
translation: They put on their forehead the dust of the lotus feet
And come to know the creator as the root cause of all the causes.
When flame (of knowledge) flashes in their heart, the unstruck melody starts ringing.

gurmukhi: ੧੪ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਾਂ ਦੇ ਲੱਛਣ ਤੇ ਧੂੜ ਦਾ ਪ੍ਰਤਾਪ
translation: Virtues of the gurmukhs and the glory of the dust
The power of the one vibration of the Lord transcends all limits.
The wonder and power of Oankft is indescribable.
It is with His support that millions of rivers carrying life water go on flowing.
In His creation, the gurmukhs are known as invaluable diamonds and rubies
And they remain steadfast in gurmati and are accepted with honour in the court of the Lord.
The path of the gurmukhs is straight and clear and they reflect the truth.
Myriad poets desire to know the mystery of His Word.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਰਜ ਘੋਲਿ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਵਾਣੀਅੈ
transliteration: Charan Kaval Raj Gholi Anmrit Vaaneeai.
translation: The gurmukhs have quaffed the dust of the feet of Gum like amrit.
This tale is also ineffable.
Waheguru, the wondrous Lord is ineffable

gurmukhi: ਕਾਦਰ ਨੋ ਕੁਰਬਾਣੁ ਕੀਮ ਨ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ
transliteration: Kaadaru No Kurabaanu Keem N Jaaneeai.
translation: I am sacrifice unto that creator whose value cannot be estimated.
How could anybody tell how old is He?
What could I tell about the powers of theLord who enhances the honour of the humble ones.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਜਿਮੀ ਅਸਮਾਣ ਤਿਲੁ ਨ ਤੁਲਾਣੀਅੈ
transliteration: Lakh Jimee Asamaanu Tilu N Tulaaneeai.
translation: Myriads of earths and skies are not equal to an iota of His.
Millions of universes are wonderstruck to see His power.
He is king of the kings and His ordinance is obvious.
Millions of oceans subsume in His one drop.
Explanations and elaborations pertaining to Him are incomplete (and fake) because His story is ineffable.
Conduct of the gurmukhs
Gurmukhs know well how to move according to the command, hukam of the Lord.
Gurmukh has ordained that community (panth), who moves in the will of Lord.
Becoming contented and true to faith they gratefully thank the Lord.
Gurmukhs perceive His wondrous sport.
They behave innocently like children and eulogize the primaeval Lord.
They merge their consciousness in the holy congregation and truth do they love.
Identifying the word they get liberated and
Loosing their sense of ego they perceive their inner selves.
Glory of the true Guru
The dynamism of the Guru is unmanifest and unfathomable.

gurmukhi: ਗਹਿਰ ਗੰਭੀਰ ਅਥਾਹ ਹਾਥਿ ਨ ਅਾਣੀਅੈ
transliteration: Gahari Ganbheer Adaah Haadi N Aaneeai.
translation: It is so deep and sublime that its extent cannot be known.
As from each drop become many tumultuous rivulets,
Likewise the ever-growing glory of gurmukhs becomes ineffable.
His shores near and far cannot be known and He is adorned in infinite ways.
The comings and goings cease after entering the court of the Lord i.e. one becomes liberated from the bondage of  transmigration.
The true Guru is totally carefree yet He is the power of the powerless ones.
Blessed is the true Guru, seeing whom all feel wonderstruck
Holy congregation is the abode of truth
Holy congregation is the abode of truth where gurmukhs go to reside.
Gurmukhs adore the grand and powerful true name (of the Lord).
There skillfully they enhance their inner flame (of knowledge).

gurmukhi: ਸੋਧਿ ਡਿਠਾ ਬ੍ਹਮੰਡੁ ਲਵੈ ਨ ਲਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Sodhi Ditdaa Brahamandu Lavai N Laaeeai.
translation: Having seen the whole universe I have found that none reaches His grandeur.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਸੁ ਨਾਹੀ ਜਮ ਡੰਡੁ ਸਰਣਿ ਸਮਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Tisu Naahee Jam Dandu Sarani Samaaeeai.
translation: He who has come to the shelter of the holy congregation has no longer the fear of death.

gurmukhi: ਘੋਰ ਪਾਪ ਕਰਿ ਖੰਡੁ ਨਰਕਿ ਨ ਪਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Ghor Paap Kari Khandu Naraki N Paaeeai.
translation: Even the horrible sins are decimated and one escapes going to the hell.
As the rice comes out of husk, similarly whosoever goes to the holy congregation gets liberated.
There, homogenous truth prevails and falsehood remains far behind.
Conduct of the gursikhs
Bravo to the Sikhs of Gum who have refined their lives.
The right living of the Sikhs of the Guru is that they love the Guru.
Gurumukhs remember the name of the Lord with every breath and every morsel.
Epudiating pride they remain detached amidst maya.
Gurmukhs consider hemselves as the servant of the servants and service only is their true conduct.
Pondering upon the Word, they remain neutral towards hopes.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਹਜਿ ਨਿਵਾਸੁ ਮਨ ਹਠ ਮਾਰਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Sahaji Nivaasu Man Hatd Maariaa.
translation: Eschewing stubbornness of mind, gurmukhs reside in equipoise.
Enlightened  of gurmukhs salvages many a fallen one.
Conduct of the gurmukhs
Those gurmukhs are acclaimed who have found the true Guru.
Practising the Word, they have emancipated their whole families.
Gurmukhs have the Will of God and they work according to the truth.
Eschewing ego, they obtain the door of liberation.
The gurmukhs have made the mind understand the principle of altruism.
The base of gurmukhs is truth and they (finally) get absorbd into truth.
Gurmukhs are not scared of public opinion
And this way they visualise that imperceptible Lord.
Nature of the gurmukhs
Touching the philosopher's stone in the form of gurmukh all the eight metals transform into gold i.e. all the people become pure.

gurmukhi: ਅਸਟ ਧਾਤੁ ੲਿਕ ਧਾਤੁ ਪਾਰਸੁ ਪਰਸਣਾ
transliteration: Asat Dhaatu Ik Dhaatu Paarasu Parasanaa.
translation: Like the fragrance of sandal they permeate all the trees i.e. they adopt one and all as their own.
They are like Ganges in which all the rivers and rivulets merge and become full of vitality.
Gurmukhs re the swans of Manasamvar who are not perturbed by other cravings.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਨ ਸਰੋਵਰ ਹੰਸ ਨ ਤ੍ਰਿਸਨਾ ਤਰਸਣਾ
transliteration: Maan Sarovar Hans N Trisanaa Tarasanaa.
translation: The Sikhs of the Guru are the paramharisas, the swans of the highest order
So do not mix up with ordinary ones and their sight is not easily available.
Craving reposed in the shelter of Guru, even the so called untouchables become honourable.

transliteration: Saadhasangati Sach Khandu Amar N Marasanaa ?21??22?baaee?
translation: The company of the holy, forms the regime of Truth everlasing.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ੳੁਪਦੇਸ ਰਿਦੈ ਨਿਵਾਸ ਨਿਮ੍ਰਤਾ ਨਿਵਾਸ ਜਾਸੁ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਗੁਰ ਮੁਰਤਿ ਕੈ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gur Oupadays Ridai Nivaas Nimrataa Nivaas Jaasu , Dhiaan Gur Murati Kai Pooran Braham Hai ?
translation: The Sikh in whose heart resides the percept of Guru, and by focusing his mind in the holy feet of the Lord through Simran, the omnipresent Lord dwells in him;

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ੳੁਨਮਾਨ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਸਹਜ ਸੁਭਾੲਿ ਸਰਬਾਤਮ ਕੈ ਸਮ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gurmukhi Sabad Surati Ounamaan Giaana , Sahaj Soubhaai Sarabaatam Kai Sam Hai ?
translation: He who lodges the holy word of the True Guru, contemplates on spiritual knowledge and in the process realises that One Supreme Lord exists in all, thus treats all as equals;

gurmukhi: ਹੳੁਮੈ ਤਿਅਾਗਿ ਤਿਅਾਗੀ ਬਿਸਮਾਦ ਕੋ ਬੈਰਾਗੀ ਭੲੇ ਮਨ ਓਨਮਨ ਲਿਵ ਗੰਮਿਤਾ ਅਗੰਮ ਹੈ
transliteration: Haoumai Tiaagi Tiaagee Bisamaad Ko Bairaagee Bhaay , Man Ao?naman Liv Ganmitaa Aganm Hai ?
translation: He who sheds his ego and becomes an ascetic by virtue of Simran, yet live a detached worldly life; reaches the inaccessible Lord,

gurmukhi: ਸੂਖਮ ਅਸਥੂਲ ਮੂਲ ੲੇਕ ਹੀ ਅਨੇਕ ਮੇਕ ਜੀਵਨ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਨਮੋ ਨਮੋ ਨਮੋ ਨਮ ਹੈ ||੨੨||
transliteration: Sookham Asadool Mool Ayk Hee Anayk Mayka , Jeevan Moukati Namo Namo Namo Nam Hai ?22?
translation: He who recognises one Lord manifested in all things subtle and absolute; that Guru-conscious person is emancipated even when living a worldly life. (22)
